item.title: üöÆ The Ad Blocking Problem
item.description:
How I’m currently blocking Ads at home, and why?

In this article, I’m writing about the various solutions I’ve recently explored to block ads and I also describe the solution I’m currently using!

Pi-hole

Pi-hole is a cool open source project to block ads on your whole network. You set this up on a small Raspberry Pi (hence the name, heh), and then reconfigure your internet to use the pi-hole as your primary DNS, it will then nuke carefully all DNS requests sent to this tracking and ads endpoint. Make sure you whitelist your company corporate domain names or else working will get a little more complicated.

this article is for macOS only.

If you use git and gpg to sign your commits, then you’re probably used to sign you commits using a physical key that you have to insert and press with your finger when you are creating a commit.

Unfortunately, there is no visible feedback in the console when git awaits for a yubikey touch and this means that you can sometime miss these.
